definitions.definition: of a title, by virtue of one's (living) spouse; often contrasted with regnant and dowager
examples: Queen Elizabeth The Queen Mother took on nearly as many duties as queen dowager, after her husband's death, as she had had when she was queen consort during his reign.

main_definition: ( postpositive ) of a title, by virtue of one's (living) spouse; often contrasted with regnant and dowager
